stream_context.summary: Kaze debugs performance with a new profiler, optimises Course 13’s snow-slide area, and imports a large batch of Oily Boily Bay assets supplied by Biobak.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen’s new combined trace + profiler shows that ~76 % of each frame is spent in an idle while-1 loop, revealing a major memory/RSP bottleneck.
development_findings.quote: Funny thing about RTYI, 25 out of 33 ms are spent on a while 1 loop. It’s all idle.

development_findings.summary: RSP and RDP tasks are imbalanced; the RDP runs slightly longer than the graphics task, signalling the game is currently RSP-bottlenecked.
development_findings.quote: The crazy thing is the RDP runs just a little bit longer than the GFX right now, which shouldn’t be the case… we’re RSP bottlenecked.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rewrote sine/cosine look-ups to polynomial approximations, gaining ~400 µs per frame and increasing analogue precision from 4,096 to 65,536 angles.
development_findings.quote: I switched to a polynomial… it increased the accuracy a lot as well.

development_findings.summary: A memory-heavy slide in Course 13 crashed due to excessive collision surface nodes; this led Kaze to implement a new memory allocation scheme highlighted in a recent ‘KazeClips’ video.
development_findings.quote: When I first made this slide I ran out of memory… because of that we gained 400 µs of computing time.

development_findings.summary: Camera/readability tweaks: Kaze scales the slide mesh and adjusts camera horizon instead of tilting the camera, prioritising player visibility of hazards.
development_findings.quote: Considering I don’t like changing the camera tilt, what if we just make the slide half its size?

development_findings.summary: Fast64 sometimes auto-selects sub-optimal texture formats, causing rendering bugs (e.g., Koopa shell, glass); Kaze fixes these by forcing RGBA16 and adjusting combiners.
development_findings.quote: Fast64 automatically picked the wrong one… it shows up entirely white no matter where you look at it from.

development_findings.summary: Path-following bug on Wiggler was traced to a logic error skipping waypoints when x-distance exceeded 200 units; removing that check fixed erratic turning.
development_findings.quote: That’s why the path was so buggy at first because I was skipping waypoints… now it’s fixed.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s first child, Raina, is overdue by two days; he’s on a two-month paternity leave which he plans to spend optimising the game.
context_findings.quote: I’m still on two months of paternity leave. I’m gonna spend that time trying to optimise the operating system on my N64.

context_findings.summary: He views optimisation as a creative puzzle and jokes about ‘Rambus goes vroom vroom’ becoming a catch-phrase because he tired of repeating technical jargon.
context_findings.quote: I just kept saying Rambus goes vroom vroom in my notes because I didn’t care and then people loved it.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with Germany’s bureaucracy and contemplates emigration (mentions Canada) in a broader discussion on taxes and quality of life.
context_findings.quote: Living in Germany sucks. I’m so glad I moved out.

biobak.summary: Delivered a large ‘Oily Boily Bay’ asset dump: new tox boxes, womp tower, mop Koopa, builder Koopa, wiggler faces, glass textures, etc., each with detailed change-logs to cut materials, triangles, and bones.
biobak.quote: Goal new design and one fewer material… it’s like ten fewer bones total across all of the womps.

biobak.summary: Asset optimisations help the level hit 30 FPS; Kaze confirms performance improvement after imports.
biobak.quote: Dang, I think we can get Oily Boily Bay at 30 FPS now.

biobak.summary: Provides clear notes inside blend files (e.g., ‘one fewer material’, ‘saves one bone’) which guide Kaze’s integration work.
biobak.quote: Baked helmet strap into the texture, saves one material.

biobak.summary: Engages playfully, requesting colour-guessing quiz and joking about ‘oily boily boys’, indicating a friendly rapport.

zeina.summary: Zeina is modelling the new overworld entrance area and is referenced as preparing multiple 3D assets independently.
zeina.quote: The thing I was working on for the new overworld… Zeina is making a bunch of 3D models and stuff.

key_stories.title: Uncovering the 76 % Idle Time
key_stories.summary: With Sauraen’s new profiler, Kaze discovers most frame time is wasted in an idle loop, exposing RSP/memory bottlenecks.
key_stories.challenge: Unexpected performance ceiling with no clear culprit.
key_stories.process: Integrated profiler, limited FPS for consistent data, analysed thread timelines.
key_stories.outcome: Identified idle loop and RSP overrun as optimisation targets for future work.
key_stories.key_quote: Funny thing about RTYI, 25 out of 33 ms are spent on a while 1 loop.

key_stories.title: The Slide that Broke Memory
key_stories.summary: Course 13’s large helix slide crashed due to collision memory limits; Kaze rebuilt memory allocation and shrank geometry.
key_stories.challenge: Slide’s collision exceeded surface-node allocations causing a crash.
key_stories.process: Implemented new allocator, rewrote trig to polynomial, resized slide and adjusted camera.
key_stories.outcome: Crash resolved, gained 400 µs/frame and better player visibility.
key_stories.key_quote: Every time you have a collision triangle that crosses into multiple cells… the whole thing just crashed.

key_stories.title: Wiggler’s Wild Path
key_stories.summary: Wiggler boss spun unpredictably because path code skipped waypoints.
key_stories.challenge: Erratic turning made the encounter look broken.
key_stories.process: Printed waypoint indices, found ‘distance > 200’ skip logic, removed check.
key_stories.outcome: Path traversal stable; facial animations added.
key_stories.key_quote: That’s why the path was so buggy at first… now it’s fixed.

key_stories.title: Biobak’s Asset Diet
key_stories.summary: Biobak hands over optimised models that cut materials, bones, and triangles, letting Oily Boily Bay hit 30 FPS.
key_stories.challenge: Level previously failed to maintain target frame-rate.
key_stories.process: Biobak reduced draw calls; Kaze imported assets, adjusted fog and combiners.
key_stories.outcome: Performance milestone reached; visual cohesion improved (e.g., tox boxes now match environment).
key_stories.key_quote: It’s like ten fewer bones total across all of the womps… we can get Oily Boily Bay at 30 FPS now.
